p: GC 5890 II (Hewlett-Packard GmbH, Homburg, Germany) coupled with quadrupole mass spectrometer (SSQ 7000, Thermo-Finnigan, Bremen, Germany) was used for the identification of the essential oil compounds. Instrumental settings were Gas: 4He (2 mL/min); Temp: T 0/45 째C, T 2/isothermal, T 1/300 째C, T 2/isothermal, detector/300 째C, and injector/250 째C, Split ratio: 1:20. Varian 3400 (Varian GmbH, Darmstadt, Germany) was used for GC analyses with OV-5 fused bonded column (Ohio Valley, OH, USA) and a Flame Ionization Detector (FID) for quantitative determination of the components. Mean of 3 independent runs was used to calculate areas under the peaks (AUP) using an SRI Instrument (Torrance, CA, USA) and the total area was considered as 100%. Wiley Registry of Mass Spectral Data 8th edition, National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) Mass Spectral Library (December 2005), and the literature were used to compare and identify the active constituent of spectral data [ 29, 30].
